items.content:
Sales Development Representative (Chicago)

Sales
Anywhere in US
Company: Akkroo
ContractPart Time

Overview

Note: This is a contract, part-time role that requires regular travel to Chicago, IL.

ABOUT AKKROO

Here at Akkroo, we’re on a mission to help businesses think differently about exhibiting and the way they capture and process leads at B2B trade shows and events.

We’re at the forefront of a new, emerging category that bridges the big gap between exhibiting at events and the organisation’s existing Sales and Marketing processes.

We’re based in London, UK, however have a large and growing customer base in the US and in line with our recent Series A funding are now hiring for Sales Development Representatives in key US locations, including Chicago.

Sales Development Representatives play an incredibly important role in Akkroo, helping us to proactively qualify buying interest, understand size and shape of potential accounts and line them up for further conversations and demos with the Account Executive team.

ABOUT THE ROLE 

This role is all about helping us to generate well qualified sales leads in the US.

The role will involve a mixture of:

  • visiting local B2B trade shows, exhibitions and events, mostly at McCormick Place Exhibition Centre, to open conversations with great-fit customers
  • prospecting into target accounts, utilizing a modern suite of outbound sales tools, campaigns and social outreach
  • handling inbound enquiries received via the Akkroo.com website outside of UK working hours to qualify those leads and transition into the sales pipeline

    • You’ll be part of our larger, UK-based Sales team with a focus on identifying and qualifying great-fit customers which are then passed over to our Account Executive team for demo and closing

    You’ll also work alongside our Marketing team to identify sectors, organizations and events to target

    This is a part time, remote and flexible contract position – the exact number of hours each week may vary, but we’re anticipating around 30 hours.

    ABOUT YOU
    • You have previous B2B sales experience, either as an Account Executive or SDR role, ideally within a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) organization
    • You love speaking to new people and are just as comfortable face-to-face as you are on the phone, via email or live chat through our website
    • You’re willing and able to travel to events (occasionally at weekends) to meet new prospects
    • As this is a remote role, you’re able to do great work independently and love the challenge of solving problems, proactively tackling challenges and when you don’t know something, you embrace the chance to grow and get better
    • You’re setup to work remotely, with a suitable working environment and able to invoice us on a bi-weekly basis for your hours worked as a contractor

      • WHAT WE’RE OFFERING

      This is a fantastic opportunity to join a successful European scale-up as one of our early teammates on the ground in the US

      We’re paying competitive salary, based on an hourly rate for a fixed number of hours. On top of this, you’ll receive a commission scheme based on generating Sales Qualified Leads

      You’ll be provided with all the tools you need to successfully do the job, including a MacBook and access to a suite of software that we use, including Slack, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, SalesLoft and Hubspot CRM

      To apply for this job please visit the following URL: http://akkroo.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk01l8a?apply=true →

items.content:
Account Executive - North America

Company: Qwilr
Headquarters: Sydney, Australia
http://jobs.qwilr.com/o/account-executive-north-america
We're looking for an experienced Account Executive based out of the North America to join our growing global sales team. 

At Qwilr, our sales team serves as a trusted advisor for prospects and customers - listening to their needs, clearly explaining what Qwilr is (and isn't), and leading our initial training and onboarding efforts to make sure everyone is successful for the long term. 

Note: While you can be located anywhere in North America, you will need to be comfortable working Pacific coast hours so that you can overlap with the team in Sydney. 

To see this page as a beautiful Qwilr, and get more details, here.

Requirements

You have 2+ years of successful selling to SMBs, and have experience working on deals similar in size (1k to 10k ACV) and volume to the ones you’d be working on at Qwilr. 

You have worked for an excellent SaaS Sales company. This could be a startup or a big player like Salesforce or HubSpot, but we're looking for someone who has experienced an excellent sales culture. 

You are excellent at inbound - but you're not afraid of occasional outbound. We get thousands of inbound leads per month - but there are times that outbound makes sense. 

You know your way around a modern CRM. You will need this for your day-to-day, as well as for helping our clients as we embed deeply into CRMs like Salesforce & HubSpot. 

You are in sales because you love helping people win. It energises you to work alongside people to improve their business. 

You are naturally curious and have a history of learning new things quickly. At Qwilr, our product is always evolving, as is our market. Things will change - you need to be comfortable adapting to that change. 

You excel at managing yourself like a successful business. You are highly organised, you set and achieve goals with regularity, you create a great customer experience, and you make your teammates better. 

Above all, you’re an entrepreneur and are excited by the prospect of building your business and hitting your quarterly and annual goals. 

The Simple Benefits 

Competitive Salary & Comp - with uncapped commissions. 
Equity - Everyone at Qwilr owns a meaningful stake in our success. 
Paid parental leave - 12 weeks for primary caretaker and 4 weeks for secondary caretaker. 
Company Retreats - Every year we get together to meet and work in person in an amazing location somewhere in the Pacific (typically near a beach). 
Complete transparency - Everyone has access to business metrics and financial information about the company. 
Further Education support - We'll cover all courses below $1000 and split the ones above with you 50/50. We'll happily buy you any business books you'd like to read - even if they're outside of your role. 

The Real Benefits

Impact

Every member of Qwilr is actively encouraged to input and contribute to the direction of the product and the company. We actually have a formal process around The Big Questions at Qwilr called “Group Think”. Ideas can come from any quarter and shape our whole trajectory. 

Work with smart people who care about what they do

We’ve got that list of impressive backgrounds we can reel off (Google, Microsoft, Campaign Monitor, McKinsey, Harvard etc) - but what you really need to know is this: Qwilr is fierce about finding the best people and providing them an environment to flourish. That means we’ve got a team of really smart people, who really care about, and take pride, in what they do. 

We have a high bar of excellence 

Our first principle as a company is “Undeniable Bestness”. We believe in winning our race by being the best, not throughs hacks, bandaids and shortcuts. This means we have a high bar of excellence at the company. We go back to the drawing board when things aren't right, because we care deeply about the quality of what we produce.



Our Process - What To Expect.


  • Tell Us Something About Yourself: Together with your CV, send in a Qwilr Page telling us who you are, why you think you would be great for the role, and what your favourite sale was. 
  • Chat with our Talent & Culture Lead: If your Qwilr Page resonates with us, we'll set up a get-to-know-you chat with Elisa. 
  • Chat with a Founder: If you look like a good fit you'll chat with Mark, the Founder who leads our Sales team. 
  • Pitch us Qwilr:  We find that there is no better way to find out if someone will be good for the job than to have them do the job in a simulated environment. We do this in some capacity for all hires across Qwilr. This task will mirror what it’s like working with our prospects in a sales call. 
  • Chat with the sales team: As things progress you’ll chat with two or three of our Sales & Success team. This will be an opportunity for you to get to know us at a human level, and for us to get to know you. 


Why Qwilr?


Qwilr makes it easy for people to express themselves using the web. 

We have thousands of customers from over 50 countries, we have an excellent product, our team is doubling in size every year (and our revenue is growing even faster), we are backed by some of the best SaaS investors on the planet, and we are growing like crazy. 

Now is the time to join.

Apply for this position

To Apply head to: http://jobs.qwilr.com/o/account-executive-north-america And submit a CV as well as a Qwilr Page telling us A) Who you are and why you think you would be great for this role, and B) What your favourite / best sale was. We want to know the details, why it mattered to you, how you did a great job and anything else that you think is relevant / impressive.

items.title: Social Media Manager
items.content:
Social Media Manager at PayBear

Remote | Freelance | International

Remote

Contract

Skills
Social Media, Social Media Marketing
Compensation
$58K – $90K
No Equity
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

We’re a small, distributed startup in a competitive space trying to do the impossible. We’re creating a payment platform for ecommerce & SaaS merchants to easily accept cryptocurrencies. We’ve already built a product that’s way ahead of the competition, but now we need key talent to scale.

Job Description

Paybear is a cutting-edge cryptocurrency platform working towards the creation of a global toolkit for crypto-based financial products. With the initial version of our payment gateway already up and running, we’re currently focused on incorporating new products into our growing ecosystem.

Now, we’re on the hunt for a Social Media Manager to take control of our voice and build a community that’s as excited about the future of crypto as we are. You’ll be leading our social media strategy, curating our brand presence and driving engagement with passionate crypto fans across the globe.

Responsibilities

  • Research and analyze leading trends, communication methods and audience preferences.
  • Design and implement an effective social media strategy to enhance business objectives.
  • Set specific, measurable objectives and report on ROI.
  • Create, edit, publish and share engaging content on a daily basis (e.g. original text, photos, videos and news).
  • Monitor SEO and web traffic metrics.
  • Collaborate with other teams, including marketing, sales and customer service, to ensure brand consistency and create engaging, shareable stories.
  • Engage regularly with the community and monitor customer reviews.
  • Supervise the creation of design assets, including Facebook cover images, profile pictures, banners and so on.
  • Create and implement new features and campaigns to cultivate brand awareness, such as promotions, competitions and other engagement initiatives.
  • Passionately follow current tech and trends in social media, design tools and applications.

Requirements

  • Fluent English, both spoken and written.
  • 3+ years’ proven experience in social media management.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Hands-on experience in content management.
  • Ability to conceptualize and deliver creative content (text, image and video).
  • Knack for distilling complex social media data into easily-digestible takeaways.
  • A natural multi-tasker able to handle a variety of ongoing projects.
  • Deep knowledge of Facebook’s advertising platform is a must.
  • Knowledge of various online marketing channels.
  • Willingness to learn new channels and platforms relevant to crypto and ICO communities.

Terms of employment

  • Full-time: 40 hours/week.
  • From $30 USD/hr.

Our advantages

  • No corporate drudgery: Work when you want, how you want, and where you want. Our international team is fully remote.
  • Absolute freedom: Our lean approach will give you the independence needed to solve challenges your way. We’re dedicated to the startup spirit.
  • Cutting-edge tech: Gain priceless, hands-on experience with crypto currencies and other leading technologies.
  • Friendly English-speaking team: Forge meaningful relationships with colleagues around the world.
Apply for job

items.content:
Director of Business Management

Company: Aha Media Group
Headquarters: Silver Spring, MD
https://ahamediagroup.com/
Directorof Business Management will lead operations, finance and technology for afast-growing company. This person will report to the President, be a part ofthe Executive leadership team, and manage the Bookkeeper and Systems Manager.

Whilethis is a primarily remote position, you must live within the Washington D.C. metropolitanarea to travel to company headquarters in Silver Spring, MD up to 2 times perweek. Commuting expenses will not be reimbursed.

Theideal candidate willdemonstrate the ability to:
· Forecast business needs and adjust businessoperations to respond to needs
· Take an “outside-the-box” approach toproblem-solving
· Communicate business performance, stats andpriorities to the President and provide 
  analysis and plausible solutions

You willhave a bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance or related field and alsobe expected to travel to in-person team meetings approximately 2-4 times peryear.

Responsibilities
  • Financial operations, including accounts receivables, accounts payable, budget, financial reporting and analysis, and payroll processing in multiple states
  • Business operations, including contracts and vendor paperwork, project compliance, insurances, SIMPLE IRA and business registrations
  • Information technology and business systems, including Salesforce, email client management, web-hosting and domain registrations, project management software, and other office systems
  • Pricing analysis and financial forecasting, including implementing processes and systems to achieve profit targets as well as support sales strategies

You Have
  • 7-10 years of accounting or finance experience ideally in a small business environment
  • Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance or related field
  • Proven experience managing junior team members
  • Expertise in QuickBooks and Excel
  • Proficiency in Salesforce and ability to quickly learn other business software as needed
  • Excellent organizational skills; this role involves a lot of moving pieces
  • Knowledge that the devil is in the details—no i goes undotted, no t goes uncrossed
  • Excellent communication skills, this role involves communication with clients and internal team members
  • A scrappy, can-do attitude with a willingness to try new ways of thinking and working
  • Proven ability to manage confidential information
  • Ability to work from 9-5, Monday through Friday
  • Ability to travel to onsite meetings at least twice a week in Silver Spring, MD
  • Proven ability to successfully work from home

Aha Media is a fast-pacedatmosphere. If these align with your values, you should apply:
·  Above and beyond, no matter what,every single time: We hire exceptional people 
   and expect them todeliver their very best—every time.

·  Meaningful work, meaningful life: We put inthe time we need to get the job done 
   in the best way possible, and then we go home to the people and hobbies we love.

·  Be impeccable with your words andyour intentions: We are respectful and direct 
   communicators whosay the things we mean and mean the things we say.

·  Stay curious longer: Weapproach every challenge with a fresh perspective and 
   explore new approachesand solutions.

·  Always be learning: We focuson continuous learning and self-improvement.

Apply for this position

If you are interested, please submit:• Resume• Cover letter (include where you found the job posting, the city & state you live in, your educational background and # of years accounting, finance or related experience)• Please include a P.S. with the number 6 in your cover letter and send your application to careers@ahamediagroup.com

items.content:
Backend Developer (for our ROIBACK business)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: B2B, Information Technology, Travel & Tourism
Company size: 5k-10k people
Company type: Private
Company: The Hotelbeds Group | Palma, Spain

Remote details

Office Location: Palma, Spain. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

javascript
python
sql
html5
linux

Job description

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES.


How can you help us?

We are seeking for top programmers and software architects to be part of our technology team.

As a software developer:


• As part of our booking engine team, implementing user stories with high business value using good techniques and practices.
• Helping the Product Ower in clarifying, prioritizing and estimating the user stories.
• Designing technical solutions and developing clear, testesable and efficient code, performing peer reviews with your collegueas.
• Ensuring continuous integration and build is in place.
• Collaborating with architects and other developers to produce just enough design and just enough technical documentation.
• Writing technical user stories for refactoring the existing code or implementing new technical features.

As a software architect:


• Doing some up front architecture envisioning to get started the developments in the right direction, collaboratively working with the team.
• Facilitating the architectural modeling and evolution efforts of our technological platform.
• Understanding of the business domain and communicating the architecture to developers and to other project stakeholders.
• Practising code review, pair programming and other agile techniques to improve the development team programming skills.
• Transitioning architectural skills to other team members

What can we offer you?


• To participate in very challenging projects with the top hotel chains from Europe, Asia and America, from the idea to the delivery.
• To work in a Company that invests (really invests) in technology.
• To be part of an Agile culture to obtain the best results in software development and to become a high-performance team, in a really happy environment.
• Work together with extremely passionate programmers, and being part of a top programmer community.
• To be part of a team-making decisions, to determine the technical roadmap of our platforms.
• To lead both business and technical projects from end-to-end.
• To live in the best city of the World

(http://www.thesundaytimes.co.uk/sto/style/homes_and_gardens/best_places/article1533629.ece)

CANDIDATE PROFILE.

• It is a must to hold a University degree in Engineering or Computing Sciences, or having completed at least 80%.
•  If you know Python or Go ... excellent! But what we are really looking for is a top programmer who loves technology and software development, and ready to learn any programming language that could be required.
• You have to feel comfortable working with databases (SQL and NoSQL), web programming (HTML5, CSS3, Javascript) and Linux environments.
• Good programming best-practices, such continuous integration, unit testing generation, code repositories, log management, code comments and documentation ...
• You will need to meet with the business to understand the needs and to translate them into code.
• You will be part of an agile team, so, what is really important in Roiback is the team success, not the individual success.
• It is not a must to have a lot of experience. For us, what is really important is the potential and attitude you have to become a great programmer

Apply now

About The Hotelbeds Group

Roiback.com

About us

We specialise in the development and management of online projects for hotel chains and independent hotels. We not only have a knack for all things digital, but we also have a knack for people. We know that the closer we are to you, the better and more adapted solutions we'll provide to your business. We have over 15 years experience in the industry, which has allowed us to develop a team of professionals who exceed in their fields. WHAT WE DO: We work with our partners to get to the nitty gritty of their business. This allows us to design custom-made solutions that deliver tangible results and provide a real answer to market demand. Our passion allows us to never stop improving our service and product offering, day in, day out. • Integrated Marketing Online Management. We help you build your brand differentiation in today’s crowded digital space. We have a flair for everything online and a real passion for the hospitality industry. Our method is quite simple: we first analyse your needs and then define action plans that make sense for you. We bring you a fresh approach to help you get the most out of your marketing spend, finding cost-effective ways to drive more traffic, and more bookings, to your website. • Web Design & Development. Our websites are specifically created for with the hotelier in mind. Designed to work on any device, strikingly beautiful and with a slick user experience. We are passionate about building websites that will engage visitors and drive conversions, taking direct channel sales to a new level. • Booking Engine for Hotels // BACKHOTEL 4.5 We specialise in creating technology that works for hoteliers. Our booking engine brings together beautiful design and seamless user experience to capture and convert your web traffic into bookings for your direct channel. • Technology We have direct integrations with the industry’s main Channel Managers and Property Management Systems to simplify the way you manage your direct channel.

http://www.roiback.com

booking engine, web development, digital marketing, travel, tourism, web design, technology, and hotels

We’re based in London, UK, however have a large and growing customer base in the US and in line with our recent Series A funding are now hiring for Sales Development Representatives in key US locations, including Chicago.

Sales Development Representatives play an incredibly important role in Akkroo, helping us to proactively qualify buying interest, understand size and shape of potential accounts and line them up for further conversations and demos with the Account Executive team.

items.title: Emily Hirsh, Inc. : Facebook Ads Manager
items.content:
Facebook Ads Manager

Company: Emily Hirsh, Inc.
Headquarters: Remote
https://emilyhirsh.com
Department: Advertising Team
Reports to: Senior Digital Strategist

Role
  • Creating and managing client campaigns on a daily basis through a strategic lens, communicating with the client, sending weekly reports and supporting the client with strategic consultations as needed.


Responsibilities
  • Understanding the strategy of a specific campaign and client funnel

  • Tasking out different components of a campaign such as images and copy to the correct contractors

  • Loading or tasking the loading of campaigns/ads to the ads specialists

  • Reviewing, editing & loading of ad assets as needed

  • Placing and verifying pixel to ensure proper campaign tracking

  • Daily optimization of campaigns to ensure the lowest possible cost per result and an overall positive ROI

  • Proactively create, execute, and optimize creative strategies to consistently drive high-quality leads, traffic & visibility

  • Produce weekly reports for client account updates, recommendations and results

  • Follow-up with client communications, questions and concerns in a timely manner

  • Stay on top of new techniques, strategies and changes to test for better client results & campaign successes

  • Communicating with clients about the success of the campaign, and offering suggestions for ways to improve

  • Schedule & perform monthly client meetings & consultations for account goals and strategic success of each client account

  • Participate in daily, monthly and quarterly team huddles to ensure agency team members are all meeting company goals & responsibilities

Results:
First 90 days: Learn each assigned clients account and launch strategies with direction from the Director of Advertising to ensure proper execution of client goals and success. Master the “Hirsh Process” for proper client account management and ongoing optimization. Feel 100% confident by the end of the 90-day period that you can manage your accounts with minimal support and oversight needed from the Director of Advertising or the CEO.

After initial 90 days: Ads Manager should be able to perform all client tasks, communications and strategy consulting with minimal direction from the Director of Advertising and moving to be a trusted main source of contact for strategy consultation for the client while reporting to the Director of Advertising for strategy updates, guidance & insight. The ads manager will continue to learn and grow and bring innovative strategies to the Hirsh Agency and our clients.

Requirements
  • 2+ years of online marketing experience
  • Dedication to problem-solving and the ability to analyze results and make suggestions to the client based on their individual results
  • High attention to detail, proofreading, writing and editing skills for accuracy
  • Mid - Expert level knowledge of Facebook advertising (minimum 1-2 years experience)
  • Quick learner who retains information easily
  • Knowledge of various 3rd party platforms such as ClickFunnels, MailChimp, etc
  • Ability to communicate effectively
  • Access to a high-speed internet connection
  • Good time management and organization skills as a remote worker
  • Ability to communicate with clients via email & video meetings.
  • Understanding of Funnel Marketing strategies & the psychology of advertising to the customer journey
  • Excellent verbal communication skills
  • Committed to ongoing education and training to stay on top of the Facebook platform, rules, regulations, strategies and updates for proper ad execution, implementation & client success


Details: 
  • Paid training that leads to base and incentive compensation based on performance

Apply for this position

Send your resume and cover letter to jobs@emilyhirsh.com

We are looking for a communicative rock star with a passion and willingness to make things happen. If you can't wait to write captivating copy, we can't wait to hear from you.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Are you a curious innovator? A passionate problem solver? Born digital? And maybe a little wild at heart? If so, read on.

We’re DCMN – the growth marketing partner for digital businesses and startups. Our holistic, data-driven approach combines technology with expert knowledge to grow the market leaders of tomorrow. Our vision is bold: we want everyone in the world to use one of our client’s services. If you have the drive to get us there, let’s talk.


Join our ambitious, supportive and international team, and you’ll work on the following:
- Develop growth solutions for digital brands together with your client team, always with our mission in mind: to grow the market leaders of tomorrow
- Take full responsibility for assigned clients and their marketing campaigns (focus on performance-driven TV campaigns)
- Challenge client briefs and internal teams to ensure we deliver stuff that sets us apart
- Interpretation of campaign results and ability to explain them to clients and discuss the results with them on an advanced level
- Planning, buying, controlling and on-going optimisation of international marketing campaigns (with a strong focus on TV campaigns)
- Prepare comprehensible campaign reports, based on our own TV attribution tool and third-party tools
- Build good, yield-rich and long-term relationships with our (international) customers
- Advise digital commerce companies about opportunities to scale their business with data-driven and intelligent marketing campaigns
- Effectively communicate and promote our vision and philosophy to potential new clients and stakeholders
- Live the startup vibe, act as an entrepreneur, have a hands-on approach and proactively identify opportunities that go beyond your daily account managing tasks to help grow our business in the UK market


Of course we’ll need you to bring along a few things, including:
- At least 4 years working experience in digital marketing and/or DRTV
- 3-5 years of experience in planning, buying, controlling and on-going optimisation of TV campaigns in the UK (preferably also internationally)
- Good network of contacts in the UK offline/TV landscape
- First experience with Sky Advanced products, OTT campaigns and video advertising are beneficial
- Proficiency with tools such as Techedge/IMD - CARIA, etc.
- Knowledge of other offline channels (radio, OOH, etc.)
- Not afraid of working with numbers and Excel, plus strong analytical skills
- Previous experience within a startup and/or in the field of marketing for digital brands is a big plus
- Efficient and result-oriented working style
- Fluent in English (written & spoken)


And here’s what you’ll get in return for working with us:
- An awesome WeWork office space in the heart of Shoreditch full of radically supportive colleagues
- Support for your personal and professional growth, whether this means regular massage sessions and pilates classes or an overseas conference trip
- Flexibility to manage your own hours and work from home whenever you need
- A multicultural work environment, plus the chance to visit our international offices and apply for our exchange program. One year placement in New York, anyone?
- No hierarchies, freedom and full responsibility from day one. We believe top-down hierarchies just limit our progress – so we’ve created a whole new way of working

Can’t wait to get started? Then we’d love to hear from you. Please send us your CV along with any relevant documents and your earliest possible starting date. And don’t hesitate to reach out if you have any questions!

items.content:
Account Executive (m/f) // Perdoo

Company: Perdoo

Tags:
  • communication skills
  • customer success
  • account executive
  • management consulting

    • We are looking for a full-time Account Executive who will report directly to one of our founders. As our first Sales hire you’ll be responsible for selling Perdoo to CEOs and senior level execs at companies in the EU and US.

    About us

    We’re an ambitious team of entrepreneurs excited about building the next big thing in B2B. Perdoo helps companies turn ambition into reality with our SaaS tool which is based on OKR – a goal management framework used by top-achieving businesses like Google and LinkedIn. By focusing companies around common objectives, we help them fix the broken link between strategy and execution so that everyone can work together on a clear path towards success. Many well-known companies throughout the world already trust us and our product.

    About the position

    You’ll be the most important source of revenue growth at Perdoo. Your main responsibility is to convert incoming leads to customers. You’ll be selling Perdoo to CEOs and senior level execs at companies in the EU and US. Sales at Perdoo is entirely inbound and done from our headquarters in Berlin. Hence, there’s no need for exhaustive traveling, neither do you have to disturb anyone with cold calls or cold emails. Instead, you’ll talk to prospects who have already shown an interest in our product and services, allowing you to take a consultative approach by showing them how best we can help them realize their ambitions. As we scale, your insights will dictate how our sales team operates at 10x its current size.

    As our Account Executive you will

    • Achieve revenue goals and contribute to Perdoo’s overall sales strategy and growth objectives.
    • Qualify and prioritize incoming leads.
    • Perform sales demos that give prospects a good and thorough understanding of the Perdoo product and services.

    We’d love to hear from you if you

    • Have 1-4 years experience working in sales, customer success or management consulting.
    • Have at least a Bachelor’s degree.
    • Are fluent in English, German would be a plus.
    • Have some flexibility in terms of working hours as a considerable amount of our prospects is located in the US.
    • Have excellent verbal and written communication skills.
    • Are an autonomous worker and self-starter.

    What we offer

    • A fixed salary, benefits and employee stock option plan.
    • Contribute to a real-life product used by thousands of users every day.
    • Work in a dynamic, exciting and fun startup environment where every person has a voice and can have a real impact on company success.
    • Office in Berlin-Mitte, the heart of Europe’s startup scene.
    • Regular team retreats to remote locations. Last time we took the team to a finca in Mallorca.
    • An awesome rooftop overlooking Berlin with regular after-work drinks, BBQs and our annual Rooftop Party.
    • Free food and coffee in our kitchen.
    Apply for this position

items.content:
Office Manager // Idagio

Company: Idagio

Tags:
  • management
  • administration
  • music
  • Office

    • ABOUT US

    “This startup is set to revolutionize classical music” – Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung

    We are a technology company that is driven by the mission to build the world’s best streaming service for classical music lovers. We’re the only service worldwide that is able to offer the specialized search that lovers of this genre want and need. A search that they can’t and won’t get at Spotify, Apple Music or Youtube.

    We are honoured to also work directly with the world’s leading musicians and institutions, including the Vienna Philharmonic, the Philharmonia Orchestra and the Israel Philharmonic.

    IDAGIO is available to music lovers across the globe, but physically we are rooted in Berlin and consider the German-speaking countries our home base, as the world perceives them as the cradle and the center of classical music.

    WHERE YOU’LL CONTRIBUTE

    • Being responsible for the reception area, greeting visitors and for general email and phone enquiries
    • Ensuring that our team members and guests feel welcome at IDAGIO
    • Contributing to a supportive, passionate, and committed team culture
    • Maintaining correspondence with various vendors and keeping stock of office supplies
    • Supporting team members in administrative tasks such as travel bookings
    • Working closely with Finance and HR to maintain budgets, coordinate and plan team events, and onboard new team members
    • Handling requests and queries from our founders accordingly
    • Defining, developing, and implementing office procedures/policies in a fast-growing startup setting
    • Continuing to grow professionally through personal projects

    EXPERIENCE AND PERSONALITY TRAITS WE FIND RELEVANT FOR THIS POSITION

    • At least 2-3 years experience in Office Management or Administration in an international, professional environment, ideally in a startup
    • Fluency in German and English (spoken and written)
    • Impeccable time management skills and high attention to detail
    • Ability to multitask, prioritize various assignments, and solve problems dynamically
    • Knowledge of basic office tools like Excel, Google Suite, Slack etc.
    • Ability to work and make good judgments independently
    • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
    • Open, friendly and positive personality
    • A passion for classical music is a big plus

    WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER

    • Join an exceptional multinational team of 70 and shape the future of classical music
    • Enjoy a positive and purpose-driven working atmosphere in our office in Berlin Kreuzberg
    • Contribute directly to the success of our game-changing product
    • Enjoy flexible working hours, occasional remote work and using the tools and hardware of your choice
    • IDAGIO is well funded by renowned investors such as Tengelmann Ventures, Macquarie Capital and b-to-v
    • A competitive salary and a yearly education budget
    • Sharpen your piano skills on our Steinway Model D, and yes, there is good coffee too
    • We can support you with your Visa process and can answer your questions around relocation. Berlin is a beautiful city with lots to offer.
    Apply for this position

We are a marketplace that connects business owners with our network of WordPress and Shopify freelance developers and designers. The pitch: sit anywhere in the world, we match you with clients, streamline the project management, and send payment immediately.

We've been getting an influx of new projects and are looking to quickly bring more developers into the network. If you know of anyone, please ask them to apply here https://www.asklorem.com/become-an-expert

Here are some reviews on product hunt: https://www.producthunt.com/posts/ask-lorem

items.title: 10up: Technical Sales & Account Management
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=20, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Technical Sales & Account Management

Full-time
Anywhere
Remote job
Small business
Posted Aug 6 – Accepting applications

Web Strategists advance account growth and acquisition (sales) by applying a sophisticated understanding of 10up’s capabilities to client and prospect business goals, buttressed by superior communication, attention to detail, and ownership of company sales goals.

Responsibilities

  • Communicate with prospective clients via calls, video conferencing, and in-person sessions to understand goals and define strategic and tactical plans aligned to their needs and 10up strengths.
  • Write, edit, revise, and complete compelling emails, proposals, and other documents to drive prospective and current clients buy in to 10up’s strategies and approaches.
  • Negotiate client goals, constraints, and 10up resourcing and delivery standards to create detailed contracts, proposals, and project plans that set 10up and its clients up for success.
  • Support and grow client relationships via regular check-ins and collaboration with client and production teams; complete all related deliverables necessary to ensure outstanding client service in a timely and insightful manner.
  • Maintain accurate, timely, and detailed documentation for deals, client relationships, and projects.
  • Successfully manage and grow relationships with partners in hosting, technology, and related areas.

 

Requirements

  • Experience with and passion for building websites (or other platforms using web technologies).
  • Experience with and knowledge of web content management systems (CMS), preferably WordPress or similar open source platforms.
  • Experience producing client agreements and proposals.
  • Knowledge of common metrics for digital media success and popular tools and mechanisms for measuring success (e.g. Google Analytics).
  • Outstanding written communication.
  • Outstanding verbal communication.
  • Outstanding collaboration skills, inspiring consensus and collaboration from varied internal and external stakeholders.
  • Passion for helping clients and prospects move from concept to execution by matching their goals to 10up expertise.
  • Comfortable networking and building new relationships on behalf of 10up.
  • Willingness to take initiative and help with a variety of account service tasks.

 

Nice to have

  • Experience with core 10up disciplines, e.g. back and front end engineering, UX and visual design, ad strategy, and audience growth.
  • A strong familiarity with the WordPress and web development ecosystem, e.g. knowledge of popular tools, plugins, frameworks, best practices, and conventions.
  • Hands on experience building websites using PHP and WordPress.
  • Experience with the digital marketing ecosystem of tools, e.g. Google Analytics, DFP.
  • Experience with MS Office, Google Docs, Apple Pages, Apple Keynote, and Teamwork.
  • Remote working experience appreciated.

items.title: Account Executive
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Company Overview:

DeepCrawl is a pioneering cloud-based, enterprise website crawler. We’re an emerging start-up with an ambitious growth strategy and an established client base comprised of many of the world’s largest brands and digital agencies. DeepCrawl is on a mission to deliver crucial insights to teams managing large-scale, complex websites, and to become the tool that powers brands’ reporting, and supports all marketers in extracting actionable data from web properties.

Utilising some of the very latest technology, including NoSQL databases, AngularJS, Elasticsearch and AWS, the DeepCrawl technology team are on the cutting edge of SaaS design and implementation. Our Marketing, Sales and Service functions are examples of a classic SaaS model with class leading customer acquisition costs, service delivery, and customer success.

Working in partnership with major corporates and digital agencies, our client base consists mainly of digitally savvy and connected individuals who work hard and have fun. We are looking for entrepreneurial team players who match our culture of self-starters, revelling in taking responsibility and delivering excellence in an environment where they are encouraged to be innovative and self-reliant.

Key Responsibilities:

We're seeking an ambitious Enterprise Account Executive to join our EMEA Enterprise Sales Team. The Enterprise AE is a proactive, entrepreneurial and enthusiastic hustler who delivers engaging, tailored and enjoyable experiences to prospective clients throughout their buying journey. This is a great challenge to join a growing enterprise sales function, where you can build and manage key relationships, both internally and externally, while securing new business to significantly contribute to the company's growth and success.

- Source new opportunities for DeepCrawl through Outbound efforts
- Understand customer challenges to develop and present bespoke solutions
- Navigate a set of, often complex, organisational champions and decision makers to win buy-in for subscribing to DeepCrawl
- Deliver SaaS demos that are engaging and highlight how DeepCrawl can solve important client challenges/problems
- Drive revenue in the EMEA region by closing Enterprise deals
- Collaborate across Customer Success, Marketing and Product teams
- Serve as the customer’s voice when passing on market knowledge and product feedback to the Product & Dev teams

Key Criteria:

Your personality is as important as your skills and experience in determining whether or not you’ll be a success at DeepCrawl. As an Enterprise Account Executive, you will represent the company both in and out of the office (at events & meetups) and are expected to cultivate and develop strong relationships with prospective clients, so exceptional people skills are a must. Success in this position requires a consultative sales approach, ability to solve business challenges and and the ability to consultatively drive the sales process forward to meet & exceed monthly targets.

- At least 3-5 years’ experience in opening & closing business
- Experience in a SaaS company would be beneficial but not essential
- Strong listening and questioning skills with an ability to understand new people quickly
- Positive approach with a genuine drive for personal and team success
- A history of exceeding expectations and working hard to achieve goals
- Energetic, enthusiastic and thrives in a startup/entrepreneurial environment
- A fast learner who is able to understand complex or technical challenges
- Passionate about digital marketing and technology
- Ability to generate innovative ideas that solve complex problems
- Understanding of SEO (advantageous)

Why work for DeepCrawl??

- We're an innovative and fast growing tech start-up
- Raised our series A investment from a prominent venture capitalist
- An international business, with clients all over the world and offices across London, New York and Poland
- Flexible working from home & remote working policy
- Potential to travel to other offices
- Annual personal training budget
- Company trips
- Monthly office drinks & lunches

items.title: Sales Development Representative
items.content:
Overview of the role

DeepCrawl is currently growing at an exceptional rate, and in order to drive this growth we’re growing the sales development team in the London & New York offices. The team will be responsible for reaching out to potential clients, generating leads and pipelining sales meetings for the Enterprise Accounts team. This opportunity sits in the London office.

Key Responsibilities

- Take the lead in creating demand for DeepCrawl’s award winning technology by phone and email outreach, with the goal of setting meetings for our Enterprise Account Executive team
- Research potential clients, their companies and search marketing strategies in order to provide insight to the sales team
- Cold call, prospect, nurture and qualify new leads, building a healthy pipeline of prospective clients
- Collaborate with the Sales and Marketing teams on initiatives that drive demand generation and revenue growth
- Develop and deliver optimal work flows and best practices in order to make demand generation as efficient and scalable as possible

Key Criteria

- A passionate self-starter who has the ability to deliver in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
- A confident communicator who can quickly build a rapport with potential clients
- A positive, determined and resilient approach to selling
- A high degree of self-motivation and ambition
- A genuine interest in the technology space
- A naturally curious mind with a passion for keeping up with the latest trends and developments within the SEO and digital marketing industry

Why work for DeepCrawl??

- We're an innovative and fast growing start-up
- An international business, with clients all over the world and offices across London, New York and Poland
- Potential travel to other offices
- Annual personal training budget
- Company trips
- Monthly office drinks & lunches

items.content:
FreeAgent, Edinburgh and REMOTE (UK-only)

https://www.freeagent.com

At FreeAgent we help freelancers and small businesses be more successful by putting them in control of their company finances.

We have built an award-winning online accounting product that offers full end-to-end compliance, from time tracking to tax return filing. We're based in beautiful Edinburgh and we're growing from strength to strength with over 65,000 paying customers and strong YoY growth. Our NPS is off the charts (71!) - customers love what we do!

We're a growing team of over 130 people and the majority of our team are based in Edinburgh, but we have staff distributed across the UK. If you want to help us make small businesses awesome at doing their finances, we have great opportunities in our product and engineering team. Our stack is currently Ruby/Rails, JavaScript, React.js, MySQL, RabbitMQ, Elasticsearch, SmartOS.

We on a growth push and have lots of opportunities in Engineering. We’re looking for full-stack engineers, front-end specialists and experienced engineering managers.

We like to work with people who show initiative and continually seek to improve themselves, their teammates, and our codebase. Our engineering teams are small and cross functional, enjoying a great degree of responsibility. We invest in our platform (code health, scalability, security) as well as working on improving and adding new features that help our customers.

You can apply directly via the website – https://www.freeagent.com/company/careers – or feel free to get in touch with me directly: olly [at] freeagent [dot] com.

(We are looking for UK-based full-time staff only right now)

items.title: Sales Account Executive (German speaker)
items.content:
InVision is the Digital Product Design platform used to make the world’s best customer experiences. We provide design tools and educational resources for teams to navigate every stage of the product design process, from ideation to development.

Today, more than 3.5 million people use InVision to create a repeatable and streamlined design workflow; rapidly design and prototype products before writing code, and collaborate across their entire organization. That includes more than 80 percent of the Fortune 100, and organizations like Airbnb, Amazon, HBO, Netflix, Nike, Slack, Starbucks and Uber, who are now able to design better products, faster.

InVision is a fully distributed company with employees in 25 countries around the world. The company has raised more than $235 million in funding from leading investors including Accel, ICONIQ, FirstMark, Tiger Global, Battery Ventures, and Spark Capital. Visit us at InVisionApp.com and InVisionApp.com/blog.

We're looking for an Enterprise Account Executive to capitalize on our growing global footprint, and own our DACH presence as she/he accelerates rapid growth of our Enterprise sales efforts in EMEA.

*Requirements*

*5 years or more of inside sales experience in a B2B SaaS vertical
*Proven track record exceeding quota
*Referenceable executive-level customers at Fortune 2000 companies, major digital agencies and prominent tech firms
*Rolodex of contacts in leadership roles in design, product, marketing, UX or user research
*Passion, enthusiasm, energy, humor, and the ability to convey this through phone and email communications
*High degree of comfort with outbound calling
*Bias towards immediate action and results
*Willingness to learn and adapt
*Skilled multi-tasker who can wear multiple hats
*Passion for design
*Fluent German speaker
Responsibilities:

Be a visible presence for InVision in EMEA, inclusive of conferences, client and prospect onsites, networking events and the overall design community
Focus on expanding relationships with existing EMEA customers and driving net new prospect acquisition
Manage full sales cycle in a consultative manner, from initial qualification through product demo through follow up calls to closing
Develop new business opportunities through proactive efforts, in addition to handling incoming leads
Drive strategic direction of InVision sales and customer success presence in EMEA
Manage against company revenue targets
Potential to build broader team to support EMEA growth

items.title: Social Media Manager
items.content:
Exciting new startup in the process of raising equity funding is looking to bring on a Social Media Manager.

The company is bringing a popular existing game into the 21st century by integrating cryptocurrency and blockchain technology. The role will be part time initially, with the opportunity to be brought on full time. Remote working accepted for the initial stage.

Ideally the candidate will be as follows:
- Has knowledge/interest in the cryptocurrency/blockchain space
- Has the will to play a key role in the success of the company
- Is a self-starter and can work without major supervision
- Experienced in managing different social media channels
- Experienced in coming up with innovative ideas for campaigns
- Experienced in creating visuals for said social media campaigns (or at least the ideas for said ideas)

On offer is:
- The chance to be part of an exciting company
- The opportunity to work alongside smart, like minded people
- The opportunity to share ideas as a key member of the team
- The opportunity to eventually build your own team

Compensation is negotiable. Good short and long term earning opportunities.

Please apply to this role mentioning previous experience, your knowledge of crypto, why you think you would be the best person for the role and one thing of your choice which may convince us you are the right person.

items.title: Global Business Developer USA
items.content:
Who is the MOST inspiring person you know? What have they ACHIEVED that you really admire? Wouldn’t it be great if they would share their success secrets with YOU?

The obvious answer - YES - prompted us to embark on our mission, aiming to improve 10 million lives by 2022. By creating marketing campaigns, launching digital products or coaching our clients, PASSION.IO gives inspiring people the platform they deserve to share their message with the world and impact lives.

We are an international team with the majority of our customers in the US. We’ve grown from nothing to multi-million dollar business in under 2 years… because when you focus on impact, income will follow. We work together to not only make this company successful, but to transform our clients, our customers and ourselves into our best versions.

As we say, Do it with Passion, or not at all.

Do you think you’re the right fit?

We are looking for an inspiring, engaged and motivated new member for our business development team that proactively drives our US expansion and manages projects related to that.

You gained work experiences in high-paced environments and have the vision to change the future of learning.

Your mission will be to build and execute on various projects to market the Passion.io learning experience to millions of people anytime, anywhere. We work with social media celebrities with millions of followers. Working on key projects around them will be a relevant part of the job. Hence, past experience with project management, sales and strong execution skills would be beneficial. You will work in a cross-functional team to deliver high quality, outstanding work.

*What you'll be working on*
# You will analyze different verticals in the US, close partnerships, organize video productions, and build up deep functional expertise
# You work on product launches while consistently sounding out the market to help refine the products while monitoring and optimizing key performance indicators (KPIs)
# You will have ideas for further developing the products and business model, have a clear idea about the offers, and how they transform the market
# You will successfully drive projects through the lifecycle from conception to launch
# Define, structure, develop processes and tools, and show measurable results
# You will work on key projects in marketing, such as CRM, mobile, loyalty, and others to deliver high quality traffic, optimize conversion rates, and improve retention
# You will support implementing the marketing strategy and its roadmap across offers
# You will keep a close eye on the market, competition and use your research to continuously improve marketing activities
# You will identify and convert leads to active clients, including larger clients and strategic partnerships
# You will identify opportunities to further improve the sales processes, streamline operations and share best practices across markets

*What you'll bring to the team*
# Outstanding degree at a top university (likely: MBA, Wi-Ing or similar)
# Desirable: Prolonged stay abroad (> 6 months)
# You have exceptional analytic skills and a strong attention to detail as well as a hands-on mentality
# Preferably gained 2 years professional experience in high-performance environments (strategy consulting, banking, start-up, or similar)
# Proven track record of professional achievements
# Project management: You planned, implemented and controlled major projects, in particular extensive analytical, sales, and marketing work
# Preferably: supported internationalization, set up new business verticals

*What we offer you*
# Steep learning curve: Expect the steepest learning curve you have ever experienced - we are building a playground at passion.io to become the best version of ourselves. Meet and work with successful people worldwide to learn their success secrets.
# Value-based company: Be part of an open, honest, creative, and results-driven environment where your opinion is highly valued. We want to change the globe for the better by providing value to others.
# High-growth environment: You will be part of a strongly growing company with the opportunity to develop into a key contributor with incomparable responsibilities.
# Personal and professional development: You will tackle projects across departments and thereby gain a top-notch tool box to succeed in tackling bigger and bigger challenges.
# Autonomy / entrepreneurial work-style: You will only be measured by the results you produce and are in the driver’s seat, with full flexibility.
# Berlin: You will join our friendly and international team located in the heart of Berlin Mitte.

items.title: Global Business Developer Trainee
items.content:
Who is the MOST inspiring person you know? What have they ACHIEVED that you really admire? Wouldn’t it be great if they would share their success secrets with YOU?

The obvious answer - YES - prompted us to embark on our mission, aiming to improve 10 million lives by 2022. By creating marketing campaigns, launching digital products or coaching our clients, PASSION.IO gives inspiring people the platform they deserve to share their message with the world and impact lives.

We are an international team with the majority of our customers in the US. We’ve grown from nothing to multi-million dollar business in under 2 years… because when you focus on impact, income will follow. We work together to not only make this company successful, but to transform our clients, our customers and ourselves into our best versions.

As we say, Do it with Passion, or not at all.

Do you think you’re the right fit?

Training program that trains top talent in all dimensions of Passion’s business. Program candidates will gain inside perspectives, drive day-to-day management and build deep functional expertise by rotating every 3-6 months to new functional stages with different challenges.

Duration: 15 months total, fast track: 12 months depending on exceptional performance

Alumni will then build verticals globally from scratch to market leadership or become a key player in functions such as online marketing, product development, sales and operations.

You are responsible to excel in 6 modules. During the program, you will be assigned to a mentor you report to on a bi-weekly basis and direct responsible individuals (DRIs) for each program stage where you lead diverse projects to lift Passion’s business.

*What you'll be working on*
* Product Launch
# You work on product launches while consistently sounding out the market to help refine the products while monitoring and optimizing key performance indicators (KPIs)
# You will have ideas for further developing the products and business model, have a clear idea about the offers, and how they transform the market

* Marketing

* Sales
